ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course gave a great overview to land use practices in the US. I learned a great deal about how interconnected land use planning is with all kinds of environmental issues and thought that the course was well designed and had great readings and lectures.
Basic knowledge in land use law

I had no previous knowledge about Land Use Planning and I felt I got a very good foundation in the subject matter from this course. I have a much greater appreciation for the opportunities for good land use planning to contribute to society in a number of ways, including related to environmental considerations.
Overview of various land use topics -- how do the rules and planning mechanisms that govern our development affect how we live, work, socialize, and travel.
I learned how to more effectively think about land use and city planning.
The material that was newest to me was information about zoning.
Appreciation for the role of land use planning in development of energy projects (renewables and distribution).

Good general overview of land use planning issues, and helpful to consider how land use laws interact with environmental issues and solutions like climate change, clean energy, urban sustainability, etc.
I learned the basics of land use planning in the US, such as transit-oriented development, regional planning, and green infrastructure
Understanding of the role land use planning plays in natural resources management, opportunities and challenges.
A great overview of Land Use Planning from a professional, planning, and legal perspective.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: I didn't really have too many expectations coming into this class and found that I was very surprised at how much I learned throughout the course especially considering that it was an online course.
Similarly
Very well. The quality of the materials, organization and content exceeded my expectations. I think the content and subject matter of this particular course are well suited to the online format.
Very well.
the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class were how to think more temporarily and critically about urban centers.
I was hoping to learn more in this course - I felt the lectures could have gone into greater depth on the topics selected.
Fine
Fairly well.
Yes, it aligned very well.
Very well. Just an overview of topics with the opportunity to delve deeper into ones of interest.
The knowledge, skills, an insights gained in this class highly aligned with my expectations. It provided a great overview of the subject.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: I tend to find that online courses are often less engaging but I really enjoyed the lectures within this class. I thought the videos were a good length and that the content was diverse and covered a great deal of perspectives related to land use and environmental management. I also thought the readings were well selected.
Good survey of the field, but very basic

Materials are very good, content also very good. The only weakness is the lack of interactivity due to the online format of the course but at the same time the content is well suited to an online format. Perhaps creating a "blog" or chat room or something could create a bit of interactive discussion.
Strengths: Guest speakers were interesting and enthusiastic.
I think it's great the way it is
The course is too superficial for the topics selected. Some of the lectures were quite long but didn't go into specifics.
I appreciated the video/online format of the course and opportunity to take it at my own pace.

Strengths - interesting material, well-organized modules. Weaknesses - it felt like this course needed an update, particularly when it addressed issues of social and racial justice. The way that those issues were framed felt out of date, and I would have appreciated a more diverse perspective and solutions-oriented focus to be brought to those modules.

The strength of the course is that it can be conducted on my time. The weakness is that some of the lectures are difficult to follow because the guest lecturers aren't professors and thus accustomed to teaching.
Maybe a written transcript of what was said? I wanted to refer back to lecture material but didn't have time to skip through the lecture to find things.
As an online course, I found this course to be a great introduction to the subject. I was able to watch the videos and complete the final project on my own time.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: This online course provides a great overview into land use planning and is great for students wanting to understand how environmental policy is shaped by land use planning rules. It is a one credit course and does not have too many assignments though there is quite a bit of reading and videos to watch.
Take it if you just want an intro to the field. A nice taste test.

Make the effort to get the most out of the materials and invest some time despite the fact that this in an online course. Pay attention to the lectures. The materials are good if you pay attention to them.

Even if you are not interested in land use and development, it provides good exposure to topics that will make you a more informed citizen. Makes you question the existing structures, design, and development of your town/city.
Even though you can work at your own pace, don't wait until the last minute.
I would not recommend this course to a student with a general familiarity with the material covered.
It's a good supplement to a full suite of classes.
Take this class if you want a basic introduction to land use planning!

It may have been easier to be more closely engaged in the in-person version of this course held in the Fall. In the online seminar, you don't have opportunities to ask questions of the speaker in real-time.
Good to understand the basics of Land use in the US. Very national focus
If you want an great introduction to Land Use Planning with experts in this field, take this course.
